thread.title: Stipe Miocic set to face rival Junior Dos Santos for heavyweight title in Dallas at UFC 211 in May
thread.title_full: Stipe Miocic set to face rival Junior Dos Santos for heavyweight title in Dallas at UFC 211 in May

author: rforrester
title: Stipe Miocic set to face rival Junior Dos Santos for heavyweight title in Dallas at UFC 211 in May
text:
Other Sports Round Two Stipe Miocic set to face rival Junior Dos Santos for heavyweight title in Dallas at UFC 211 in May 
Duo have fought before in 2014 where Dos Santos inflicted a rare defeat over the American By Richard Forrester Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments UFC heavyweight champ Stipe Miocic will defend his title belt for a second time when he takes on Junior Dos Santos on May 13. 
It will be the second time the duo will go head-to-head at UFC 211 in Dallas as Miocic plots his revenge . Getty Images Stipe Miocic and Junior dos Santos went head-to-head in Phoenix in December 2014 Getty Images 4 Junior dos Santos came out on top in an unanimous decision 
Dos Santos won the initial bout with the former champion handing Miocic his first taste of defeat in a unanimous decision. 
It was also awarded the “Fight of the Night” honours. 
But Miocic will head into the scrap in confident mood as he returns to the Octagan for the first time since his victory over Alistair Overeem last September. 
And the American has won his last four fights since the defeat to dos Santos including victories over Mark Hunt, Andrei Arlovski and Fabricio Werdum. Getty Images Stipe Miocic heads into the bout as heavyweight champions having defeated Alistair Overeem in his last outing related articles germaine attraction Who is Germaine de Randamie? What you need to know after her dramatic UFC 207 defeat 'HE'S A CHEAT' Michael Bisping accuses Yoel Romero of cheating in his UFC fights ahead of title clash between the warriors Conor's hotel hideout Conor McGregor keeps fans waiting 63 HOURS for an autograph as he disappears inside hotel following night out clubbing 'I wouldn't say she fights again' Dana White says Ronda Rousey has retired from mixed martial arts Getty Images 4 Junior dos Santos has lost four of his 22 fights to date 
Dos Santos on the other hand has only won three of his last six bouts but did beat Ben Rothwell last April over a unanimous decision. 
No other fights have been announced on the card but it is reported that there could be a tasty match-up between Eddie Alvarez and Nate Diaz in the offering. UFC star Conor Mcgregor shows fans his Jimmy Choo shoes as he is driven away
